A few days had passed after Akane lost interest in\nthe project.%K%P
We still hadn't come up with any plans to help deal\nwith the situation.%K%P
Akane eventually came out of her room,\nbut she still looked gloomy.%K%P
She'd reverted back to her old routine of avoiding\nanything that she considered too much trouble.%K%P
Inori was looking down. Apparently she blamed\nherself for all this.%K%P
If we even tried asking Akane what was wrong,\nshe'd get mad right away and cause a blackout.%K%P
'Mmm...'%K%P
Akane lay napping on the porch.%K%P
'Enjoying the sunshine, huh?'%K%P
Her clothes had gotten tangled up and her\nstomach was on show.%K%P
'C'mon Akane,\nyou're gonna catch a cold\nif you sleep out here.'%K%P
I tried to shake her awake, but it was no good.%K%P
'Okay, fine... If that's how it is...'%K%P
I got the futon cover from my room,\ndraped it over the slumbering goddess\nand sat down beside her.%K%P
'Nhm...mmm... Huh? Sho?'%K%P
She stirred and rubbed her eyes, then sat up.%K%P
'Did I wake you?'%K%P
'No, not really... Hey, is this futon cover yours?'%K%P
'Yeah. It may be warm out now, but I don't want you\ncatching a cold later.'%K%P
'Thanks...'%K%P
I felt relaxed as I watched Akane blush lightly and\nwrap the futon cover around herself.%K%P
'Don't get shy on me now. You sleep in front\nof me all the time.'%K%P
'Yeah, but it's kind of embarrassing to think of\nyou looking at me while I'm sleeping...\nOh, I know!'%K%P
Akane squirmed around, repositioning herself so\nher head was resting on top of my knees.%K%P
'And why is your head in my lap now?'%K%P
'I need a pillow. Plus, this way\nyou won't be able to see my face.\nAny objections?'%K%P
'I guess not...'%K%P
'Yay! Then let's just stay like this for a while.'%K%P
Akane settled down, her breathing calm and steady.%K%P
Neither of us spoke a word.\nThe only sound was the ticking\nof the clock in the living room.%K%P
'Hey, Sho?'%K%P
'Hm? What is it?'%K%P
'I'm an Aragami.'%K%P
'Yeah, I knew that already. What about it?'%K%P
'Whatever happens, I can't change who I am.\nMy lack of control is what makes me an Aragami,\nit's part of what makes me me. So...'%K%P
'...Forget it. It's nothing, really.'%K%P
Just when she was about to say something important,\nshe sank into an awkward silence.%K%P
'I'm kinda relieved.'%K%P
'Why's that?'%K%P
'I haven't been able to talk to you much lately.\nI'm happy when you tell me what you're thinking,\neven if it is just random tidbits like that.'%K%P
'Heh, you're so weird.'%K%P
'Seriously, I was starting to think you hated me.'%K%P
I finally got to hear a little of Akane's true\nfeelings.%K%P
It was hard to describe how happy that made me.%K%P
'No, I don't hate you...\nIn fact, I was worried\nyou'd given up on me.'%K%P
'I'd never do that. Neither would Inori.'%K%P
'Inori too? Really?'%K%P
'Of course. She's the one who's stuck by you the\nlongest, isn't she?'%K%P
I could tell now. Akane really had changed\nsince I first met her.%K%P
As for why she'd been acting this way lately,\nshe must have had her own reasons,\nsomething on her mind.%K%P
'That's good to know...'%K%P
'We're all friends here. That's never going\nto change.'%K%P
I patted Akane on the head. She immediately\nblushed and turned away.%K%P
'Who said you could pat my head, too?\nThat's even more embarrassing!'%K%P
'Should I stop?'%K%P
'...You don't have to.\nIt's not so bad coming from you.'%K%P
'Thanks. I'll take you up on that offer.'%K%P
'Sure...'%K%P
We spent the rest of the afternoon quietly basking\nin the warm sunshine.%K%P
That night I called another meeting.%K%P
By which I meant I talked to Inori and Maika.%K%P
'What is this all about?'%K%P
'I need your help with Akane.'%K%P
'I thought so. Not just Inori, you need me, too?'%K%P
'Of course.\nHaving you in our corner would\nmake a huge difference.'%K%P
Maika could provide a fresh set of eyes,\nmaybe some new ideas.%K%P
The same went for Inori.%K%P
Right now I was stumped, but perhaps the three\nof us could think of something together.%K%P
'Well, okay. But only because I don't like seeing\none of my tenants so depressed.'%K%P
'F-For what it's worth, I'll do anything I can\nto help Akane!'%K%P
And so thanks to Inori's sense of responsibility\nand Maika's sense of duty, I had my team ready.%K%P
'Thanks, both of you.\nI feel better about this already.\nSo, I spoke to Akane this afternoon--'%K%P
I told them about the hint of Akane's true feelings\nI'd picked up on.%K%P
'Ah, so she lost heart because she wasn't\nenjoying it anymore?'%K%P
Inori sounded relieved.%K%P
She must have been worried that she'd gone too far\nand seriously offended Akane.%K%P
'Seems that way. Any ideas how we can get her\nmotivation back? I just want her to be happy,\nlike she was before.'%K%P
And I really did.%K%P
'Me too. I hate seeing her this way.'%K%P
Inori was on my side, that was good.%K%P
'But how are we supposed to cheer her up\nagain?'%K%P
'That's where I need your help.\nI just wish we had a more\ndefinite place to start...'%K%P
'I see. I wonder if we could do something\nto jolt her back into action.'%K%P
Wondering and wishing didn't do us a lot of good.%K%P
We both groaned in frustration.%K%P
'Hmm... Do you think Akane's really given up on\nbeing an idol?'%K%P
Maika finally chimed in.%K%P
'Who knows?\nShe always enjoyed her practice so much,\nit's hard to believe she really got bored of it.'%K%P
'Maybe we can put that to the test.'%K%P
'What do you mean?'%K%P
'I think I know a way to find out how Akane\nreally feels.'%K%P
'You have a plan?'%K%P
'Hmm... Nothing definite yet, but...'%K%P
'But?'%K%P
Where was she was going with this?%K%P
'Wait here just a sec.'%K%P
Maika stood up and left the room.%K%P
She was only gone a couple of minutes.%K%P
Coming back in, she thrust some kind of paper at me.%K%P
'Take a look at this.'%K%P
'A flyer?'%K%P
'What's all this got to do with--'%K%P
'Just read it.'%K%P
I ran my eyes over the flyer.%K%P
It had information about an upcoming festival\nthat was going to be held in the park.\nOne item in particular stood out.%K%P
'A performance by local idols?'%K%P
Apparently a number of idols with ties to Kannagi\nwere going to get together for a concert.%K%P
'Is this that same flyer Akane was looking at\nback when...when I upset her?'%K%P
Right, I remembered it now!%K%P
'If she'd really gotten bored of idols,\nit's pretty unlikely she'd be reading\nsomething like this, isn't it?'%K%P
'Of course, I'm only guessing. This might have\nnothing to do with anything.'%K%P
'No, I think you're right.'%K%P
Akane would never choose to read something\nshe found boring.%K%P
Not the Akane I knew.%K%P
'I think you're right.\nThere's no way she's\ncompletely lost interest.'%K%P
We were all in agreement.%K%P
The festival and concert was tomorrow.%K%P
There had to be some way we could use this.%K%P
'Oh hey, Maika, why did you keep this?'%K%P
The question just popped into my head.%K%P
It seemed to make Maika a little\nuncomfortable, though.%K%P
'I-It's a landlady's duty to take an interest in\nher tenants' hobbies, that's all.'%K%P
She turned away as a blush started to spread\nacross her face.%K%P
I guess Akane wasn't the only idol fan\nin this house.%K%P
'A-Anyway, maybe we can take Akane to this\nconcert and watch how she reacts.'%K%P
'I think it's a wonderful idea!\nIt's the perfect venue to draw out\nAkane's true feelings.'%K%P
Encouraged by Inori's enthusiasm, we adopted\nMaika's plan.%K%P
'Okay, I'll invite her to the concert.\nThanks for your help.'%K%P
'I'm not sure I was any help, really.'%K%P
'Don't say that.\nSho only agreed after you gave it\nyour stamp of approval.'%K%P
'Exactly. Thank you, Inori.'%K%P
'You too, Maika. I think this could work out.'%K%P
'I-I'm not doing it for you or anything...'%K%P
'Try not to mess this up, okay?\nIf anyone needs me I'll be in my room.'%K%P
Having done her part, Maika got up and left.%K%P
'Do you really think this will work?'%K%P
'There's no guarantee.\nBut it could provide that little spark\nwe need to get things moving again.'%K%P
Would this be the key to re-motivating Akane?\nWho knows. It was better than sitting around\ndoing nothing.%K%P
I rushed off to go find Akane.%K%P
